author: tokey1475
content: on teku 22.8.1 (just released with TTD) and geth master I'm getting "Merge is configured, but previously seen beacon client is offline. Please ensure it is operational before the transition arrives! eta..." in Geth log repeatedly.  Teku seems happy.  Is this expected?

author: ajsutton
content: That's a new one to me.  Is this on MainNet?

author: ajsutton
content: hmm, for MainNet I'd expect Teku to be logging the error `Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid remote response: -32601: Method engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1 is not supported` since the latest geth release doesn't yet have the mainnet merge config enabled.

author: tokey1475
content: this is with the current geth code

author: tokey1475
content: I was getting something like that before I updated geth ( i think it was acutally a ttd mismatch error)

author: tokey1475
content: I got an "execution client is back online" from teku after updating geth to the latest master version

author: ajsutton
content: Ok, so that means Teku is able to call the engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1 correctly. I'm not sure why Geth is expecting more than that at this stage. Probably have to get input from one of the Geth devs on that. (cc <@360491619402776577> )

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: It's a new message we introduced that is locked every couple of minutes if we haven't seen a engine call. Might be something borked with the logic

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yeah I think we check every 30 seconds

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Whats the interval in the spec? And where can I find it?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Found it, its 120 seconds and specd here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md#authentication
